gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company education activities positively impact children’s development.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the company’s activities impact children’s development, a direct cross-scale effect. Other elements are internal policy moves or less explicit; to stay within scale limits, only the clearest link is included.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé and its internal policies and actions.; Environmental and Societal: Governments' goals and societal standards for children's health and wellness.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's actions support societal goals for children's health.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's organizational actions that directly support societal goals, specifically governments' objectives to increase physical activity among children. This establishes a clear cross-scale causal link.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'children' whose development is positively impacted by Nestlé's activities.; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé' (the company), its 'Executive Board', internal 'Policy', and 'guidelines', representing a single organization and its internal components.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'EU Pledge' (external standards/norms), 'governments' (societal-level systems), and 'external stakeholders' (interpreted as broader societal groups providing feedback for accountability, influencing the organizational level).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's actions are shaped by external societal and governmental pressures, while also directly impacting individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph highlights how Nestlé (Organizational) is influenced by external pressures from the Environmental and Societal level, such as EU Pledges, government goals, and feedback from external stakeholders. In turn, Nestlé's activities directly impact children (Individual). The decision to use three scales (Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal) involved categorizing 'external stakeholders' as Environmental and Societal to reflect broader societal influence and adhere to the scale limit.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing the Healthy Kids programme and conducting studies; Individual: Children, parents, caregivers, and schools as specific people and informal groups receiving tools and information
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé provides tools and information to schools, parents and caregivers for children's health education.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé (organizational scale) explicitly providing tools and information that causally enables schools, parents and caregivers (individual scale) to educate children about healthy hydration. This represents a clear cross-scale causal influence from organization to individuals.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé (the Healthy Kids programme) acts by providing tools and information.; Individual: Parents and caregivers are individuals enabled to ensure children learn.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé provides needed tools/info, enabling parents and caregivers to ensure children learn about healthy hydration.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is the organization enabling individuals via tools/information. Links involving schools (org->org) or direct effects on children (ind->ind) were excluded to avoid same-scale links.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing the Healthy Kids programme.; Individual: Children and their communities benefiting from the programme.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's programme causally improves children's health through nutrition and exercise initiatives.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's organizational efforts to improve individual health outcomes. The explicit causal link is from Nestlé's actions to the health of children, mapping to Organizational -> Individual. No other scales are involved in a causal manner.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people (children, parents, caregivers).; Organizational: Refers to formal entities such as the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme, schools, and the specific 'initiatives' it supports, which are understood as organized efforts or local programs.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to broader societal-level systems ('communities').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Organizational entities (Nestlé, initiatives, schools) explicitly influence individuals (children, parents, caregivers) through health improvement and resource provision, and also impact communities.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how Organizational actors (Nestlé Healthy Kids programme, initiatives, schools) influence Individuals (children, parents, caregivers) through health improvement and provision of educational resources. It also highlights the impact of Organizational initiatives on Environmental and Societal entities (communities), using clear causal verbs.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is a specific company that created the platform and launched initiatives; Individual: Five families are specific households taking action to change their eating and lifestyle habits
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's platform supports families in changing their eating habits.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where Nestlé (organizational scale) created a platform that directly supports and encourages specific families (individual scale) to change their behaviors. This represents explicit cross-scale influence from company to households.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: United for Healthier Kids platform created by Nestlé launching a TV series; Individual: Five families receiving support/encouragement to change habits
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The platform launched a TV series that supports and encourages five families to change eating and lifestyle habits.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit wording ties an organizational action (launching a TV series) to effects on individuals (supporting five families). Other mentions (society can engage; launch in Philippines) lack explicit causal effects.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is an organization that created the platform.; Individual: The five families are specific people changing their habits.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's platform directly influences families to improve their health habits.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé, an organization, creating a platform that directly influences individual families to change their habits. This is a clear cross-scale interaction from Organizational to Individual.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'children' and 'five families', specific people or informal groups.; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé' (a company) and 'United for Healthier Kids' platform/TV series (a specific program/initiative of an organization).; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'society', a societal-level system.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's platform enables societal engagement to improve children's health and directly supports families through specific initiatives like a TV series.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé (Organizational) created a platform that facilitates engagement from society (Environmental and Societal) to improve the health of children (Individual), establishing a chain of influence. Additionally, a TV series, an initiative stemming from the Organizational platform, directly supports and encourages families (Individual) to adopt healthier habits, creating a distinct Organizational to Individual link. All three scales are explicitly involved in causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities represent societal-level institutions that provide recommendations and guidance; Organizational: The company (Nestlé) is making specific product changes and commitments in response to these recommendations
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Public health recommendations drive company to reformulate products with less salt, sugar and fats.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly shows public health authorities (societal-level actors) influencing organizational behavior through recommendations that the company explicitly follows in reformulating their products. This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship from societal institutions to organizational action.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé ('we') sets product reformulation targets and commitments.; Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities and the societal fight against NCDs.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Public health guidance drives company reformulation, which contributes to society’s fight against NCDs.
gpt5: Rationale: Societal recommendations explicitly guide the firm’s ingredient reductions, and the firm states these reductions contribute to societal NCD efforts. Individuals are mentioned but no causal outcome is given.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is an organization making changes to its products.; Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities and societal health outcomes are societal-level actors.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's product changes are influenced by public health recommendations and aim to improve societal health.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how public health authorities (societal) influence Nestlé (organizational) to change its products, which in turn aims to impact societal health. These are clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'children and teenagers' who are specific people consuming products.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company, implied to be Nestlé), which is a single organization responsible for product development and commitments.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'public health authorities' (a societal institution providing recommendations) and 'society' itself (the broader societal context for health initiatives).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The company adapts products based on public health recommendations, contributing to societal health and directly influencing individual consumption.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how public health authorities (Environmental and Societal) provide recommendations that influence the company's (Organizational) actions. The company's product changes (Organizational) are stated to be a 'contribution towards' broader societal health goals (Environmental and Societal) and directly impact 'children and teenagers' (Individual) through product formulation. Three distinct scales were involved, aligning with the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. We are enhancing our portion guidance and have committed to print GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts) on the front of all relevant packaging. These make it easier for people to see how much salt, sugar or fat is in the product, and how the amounts compare to reference daily guidelines. Nestlé Portion Guidance is a voluntary initiative
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing portion guidance initiatives and committing to enhanced product labeling; Individual: People who buy products and make informed decisions based on nutritional information
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé enhances product labeling to help customers make informed purchasing decisions.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where Nestlé (organizational scale) implements labeling changes that directly influence individual consumers' ability to make informed decisions. The company's voluntary initiative of printing nutritional information is explicitly designed to affect individual behavior.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé/'we' committing to print GDAs and enhance portion guidance; Individual: People who buy the products (consumers)
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé’s front-of-pack GDA labeling makes it easier for consumers to assess nutrition and decide.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links the company's labeling actions to consumers’ ability to understand nutrition and make informed choices. Reference daily guidelines are context, not a causal actor, so excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to people who buy products and make decisions.; Organizational: Refers to Nestlé and its initiative to enhance product labels.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's label enhancements aim to improve individual decision-making.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé (Organizational) is taking steps to influence individuals' (Individual) ability to make informed decisions. This is a clear cross-scale causal link.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people who buy our products' and 'people' who make decisions.; Organizational: Refers to 'We' (Nestlé), a specific company implementing initiatives like 'portion guidance' and product labels.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts)' and 'reference daily guidelines', which are societal-level standards or norms.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Societal guidelines influence organizational information provision, which then directly helps individuals make informed decisions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal chain. Societal-level guidelines (Environmental and Societal) influence Nestlé's (Organizational) decision to print GDAs. This organizational action then directly impacts individuals (Individual) by making it easier for them to understand nutritional information and make informed purchasing decisions. The most critical link from the perspective of the company's stated goal is Organizational -> Individual.

Full Paragraph Text: that bridges the gap between dietary recommendations and more user-friendly information to promote the right portion size. It is designed to help reframe portion norms, particularly in energy dense categories where habitual servings have increased over time.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a design purpose and general trends but lacks explicit actors taking causal actions across different scales. While it mentions 'habitual servings' changing over time, no specific actor or causal mechanism is identified that would create a cross-scale interaction.

gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'habitual servings' and implicitly to people adopting 'right portion size'.; Organizational: The 'user-friendly information' and the implicit entity creating/disseminating it are considered an output or action of an organization.; Environmental and Societal: Includes 'dietary recommendations' (typically from governments/health bodies) and 'portion norms' (societal expectations).

These direct statements of purpose establish clear cross-scale influences. Only three distinct scales were identified, fitting the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') implementing microfortification programmes and delivering fortified foods globally; Individual: People, families, children, and women of child-bearing age who receive and consume the fortified foods
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company fortifies foods to help people and families stay healthy through micronutrient programmes.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organization (the company) takes action to fortify foods that directly benefits individuals (people, families, children, women). The company's microfortification programmes are explicitly designed to help these individuals stay healthy.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We” (the company) fortifies foods, delivers servings, and runs microfortification programmes.; Individual: “People,” “their families,” and target groups like children and women of child-bearing age.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the organization fortifies foods to help people and families stay healthy, indicating a causal Organizational -> Individual link. No other scales are causally involved.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes an organization fortifying foods to directly impact the health of individuals, establishing a clear cross-scale causal link. No other scales are explicitly involved in causal interactions.

This is the sole direct cross-scale interaction identified. The mention of 'commitment' and 'extending reach' further describes organizational actions, but their causal link to individuals is already captured by the primary interaction, without introducing new scales or causal pathways.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé scientists at the Product Technology Centre in Singen, Germany, are working to reduce the amount of salt in Maggi Tomato Mozzarella Soup by enhancing other flavours.

Full Paragraph Text: Research carried out by the Nestlé Research Center, and published in the journal Appetite, indicates that children who help their parents prepare their own meals eat significantly more vegetables than those children who are not involved in cooking with their parents.

Full Paragraph Text: Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Across our portfolio, innovation reinforced our growth platforms in 2014.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical and strategic aspects of Nestlé but does not explicitly state any causal influence across different scales.

The child's life being saved is by a product, not an actor-to-actor causal link.

Full Paragraph Text: We promote and support breastfeeding which is the best start a baby can have in life. Where breastfeeding is not possible, we provide breast-milk substitutes. claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational activities (promoting breastfeeding, providing products, developing solutions) but does not establish explicit causal relationships between different scales. While the organization serves individuals (babies/families), the text presents these as organizational capabilities rather than describing how actions at one scale causally influence actors at another scale.

gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Purina (a single company) conducts research and develops nutrition.; Individual: Older dogs are individual animals whose memory function is targeted.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé Purina develops neuron-targeted nutrition to help improve memory in older dogs.
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence explicitly links a company’s product development to intended improvements in individual dogs. No other cross-scale causal effects are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Purina's research efforts but does not explicitly state a causal influence across different hierarchical scales.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé Purina's organizational research and development efforts aim to improve memory function in individual older dogs.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Nestlé Purina (Organizational scale) conducts research and develops nutrition. The stated purpose of this development is 'to help improve memory function in older dogs' (Individual scale). This establishes a direct causal influence from the actions of the organizational entity to the functional improvement of individuals.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that for a company to prosper over the long term we need to create value for shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph presents a philosophical statement about Creating Shared Value but contains no explicit causal relationships between actors at different scales. It describes a belief or principle rather than specific actions or influences between identifiable entities.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “a company” is a single organization taking actions; Individual: “shareholders” are people receiving value; Environmental and Societal: “society” refers to societal-level beneficiaries
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] The company asserts it must create value for shareholders and for society.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the company creates value for shareholders and for society, indicating organizational actions affecting individual and societal scales. No reverse or additional cross-scale causality is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses a belief about creating value for shareholders and society but does not explicitly describe a causal influence across different scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Shareholders are specific people or groups receiving value from the company.; Organizational: A 'company' refers to a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: 'Society' represents a societal-level system benefiting from value creation.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] A company creates value for both shareholders and society to ensure long-term prosperity, embodying the concept of Shared Value.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that a company (Organizational) must create value for shareholders (Individual) and simultaneously for society (Environmental and Societal). These are direct, explicit causal influences from the organizational level to both the individual and societal levels, establishing two distinct cross-scale links. The link to society is often considered a critical differentiator in 'Creating Shared Value'.

Full Paragraph Text: In the Nestlé in society report we detail our progress towards meeting our 38 Creating Shared Value commitments (including three new ones for 2014). These commitments, which we introduced in 2013, make it possible for stakeholders to hold us accountable, while at the same time encouraging our management, and all our employees, to achieve continuous improvement. Creating Shared Value requires compliance with the highest standards of business practice, including international codes and standards as well as our own.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company making commitments and having management structures; Individual: All employees who are encouraged to achieve continuous improvement
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's commitments encourage all employees to achieve continuous improvement.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé's organizational commitments explicitly encourage individual employees toward continuous improvement. While stakeholders are mentioned, their role is described as holding the company accountable rather than being influenced by or influencing across scales in a causal manner.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé and its Creating Shared Value commitments are organizational policies/actions.; Individual: Management and employees are specific people within the organization.; Environmental and Societal: Stakeholders are broader societal actors outside the single organization.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé’s commitments enable stakeholder accountability and encourage employee/management improvement.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the commitments empower stakeholders to hold the company accountable and encourage management/employees to improve. References to international standards lack a direct cross-scale causal claim.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company is an organization.; Individual: Management and employees are specific people within the organization.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's commitments drive management and employees to improve continuously.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé's organizational commitments influence individual actions within the company. No other scales are explicitly linked.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'Nestlé' and its 'commitments' represent a single organization and its policies.; Environmental and Societal: 'Stakeholders' are a broad societal group that interacts with the organization.; Individual: 'Our management' and 'all our employees' refer to specific people within the organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal, Individual] Nestlé's commitments enable external stakeholders' accountability and encourage internal individuals' improvement.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details that Nestlé's 'commitments' (Organizational scale) have a causal influence on two different scales: enabling 'stakeholders' (Environmental and Societal scale) to hold them accountable, and 'encouraging' 'management and employees' (Individual scale) to improve. These are direct, explicit cross-scale causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: Global companies like Nestlé have a role to play and can make a valuable contribution to the efforts to address some of the critical issues the world faces, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability and human rights.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes potential roles and contributions that global companies could make to address world issues, but does not explicitly state any causal actions or influences actually taking place. It uses speculative language ('have a role to play', 'can make a contribution') rather than describing concrete causal relationships between actors at different scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The text is aspirational and does not specify a concrete societal actor affected. It states companies can contribute to addressing issues but provides no explicit cross-scale causal link between two mapped actors.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph mentions potential contributions by global companies but does not explicitly describe a causal influence across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'Global companies like Nestlé' refers to specific companies, which are individual organizations.; Environmental and Societal: 'critical issues the world faces, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability and human rights' are broad, societal-level challenges.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Global companies are explicitly stated to contribute to addressing critical societal issues.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the actions of 'Global companies' (Organizational scale) to addressing 'critical issues the world faces' (Environmental and Societal scale). This represents a direct cross-scale influence where organizations can impact broader societal challenges. Only two distinct scales were identified, well within the limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Our Creating Shared Value approach focuses the business on the long term, where the success of society and economic activity are intertwined and mutually reinforcing.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a general business philosophy about the relationship between society and economic activity being 'intertwined and mutually reinforcing,' but does not identify specific actors taking concrete actions that causally influence actors at different scales. The statement is conceptual rather than describing explicit cross-scale causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The statement is generic and lacks explicit cross-scale causality. It mentions society and economic activity (same scale) and an organizational focus on the long term, but no causal link across different scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses a general concept of mutual reinforcement between society and economic activity without specifying concrete actors or explicit causal links across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes an internal strategic focus of 'the business' (Organizational scale). It then states that 'the success of society' and 'economic activity' (both Environmental and Societal scale) are 'intertwined and mutually reinforcing'. While this implies a relationship, it does not explicitly state a causal influence between actors mapped to *different* scales. The 'mutually reinforcing' is described as happening *between* two elements at the same Environmental and Societal scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, at our sixth Creating Shared Value Forum, held in Switzerland, participants discussed how civil society and the private sector could work in partnership to strengthen and speed up sustainable development, focusing on the key areas of nutrition, water and rural development.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Civil society represents societal-level systems and community organizations; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Private sector represents collaboration among multiple organizations and industry sectors
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Civil society partners with private sector to accelerate sustainable development.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes explicit partnership between civil society (societal-level actors) and the private sector (inter-organizational collaboration) to influence sustainable development outcomes. This represents clear cross-scale interaction where societal actors work with sector-level entities to create change.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph only reports a discussion about potential partnerships and their possible effects; it does not state any actual cross-scale causal influence.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses potential partnerships and discussions but does not explicitly describe a causal influence across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: 'Civil society' represents a broad collection of non-state actors and communities, and 'sustainable development' is a societal-level goal or outcome.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: 'The private sector' refers to an entire industry or collection of organizations, rather than a single company.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] The private sector's collaborative efforts are identified as a means to accelerate sustainable development at the societal level.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'the private sector' (Inter-Organizational / Sector) could 'strengthen and speed up sustainable development' (Environmental and Societal) through partnership. While 'civil society' (Environmental and Societal) is also mentioned as a partner, its influence on sustainable development would be a same-scale interaction and is therefore excluded. No other explicit pairwise cross-scale causal links are present in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we renewed a long-standing collaboration with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, with a particular focus on improving rural communities’ access to water.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies are both single organizational entities entering into collaboration; Environmental and Societal: Rural communities represent societal-level groups that are the target beneficiaries of the water access improvements
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Company and Red Cross collaborate to improve rural communities' water access.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear cross-scale interaction where organizational entities (the company and Red Cross) take collaborative action that directly influences societal outcomes (rural communities' water access). The causality is explicit through the stated focus on 'improving' community conditions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We” and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies are individual organizations.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The renewed collaboration is a partnership among organizations.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] An organization renewed a collaboration, establishing an inter-organizational partnership.
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence explicitly states that an organizational actor renewed a collaboration, creating an inter-organizational arrangement. The focus on improving community water access implies intent toward societal outcomes but not an explicit causal result, so only the strongest cross-scale link is included.
4o: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: The collaboration with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies represents a system among organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Rural communities' access to water is a societal-level concern.
4o: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] The collaboration with the Red Cross aims to improve rural communities' water access, showing cross-scale influence.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a collaboration (Inter-Organizational / Sector) explicitly aiming to improve water access for rural communities (Environmental and Societal). This is a clear cross-scale causal link.
gemini2.5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The actor 'we' refers to a specific organization or entity acting as a single body.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The 'International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies' is a federation, by definition a system or collaboration among multiple national societies, thus mapping to Inter-Organizational / Sector.; Environmental and Societal: 'rural communities' are groups of people at a societal level, fitting the Environmental and Societal scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] An organization's collaboration with an international federation targets improved access to water for rural communities.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph details 'we' (Organizational) renewing collaboration with the 'International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies' (Inter-Organizational), establishing the first cross-scale causal link. This collaboration subsequently focuses on 'improving rural communities’ access to water' (Environmental and Societal), completing a causal chain across three distinct hierarchical scales. The 'renewed a collaboration with' phrase is interpreted as an active influence or sustainment of the inter-organizational relationship.

gpt5: Summary: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Nespresso’s revolutionary system – VertuoLine – was launched in 2014 in the US and Canada. It brews long cups, matching North American preferences, as well as authentic espresso.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a product launch by Nestlé Nespresso but does not establish any explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions matching North American preferences, there is no clear causality stated - no explicit influence from consumer preferences driving the product development or launch decision.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The text describes a product launch and features; 'matching North American preferences' implies alignment but does not explicitly state a causal influence across scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a product launch by Nestlé Nespresso, an organization, but does not explicitly state any cross-scale causal influence involving other scales.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] North American societal preferences influenced Nestlé Nespresso's product design decisions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Nespresso's VertuoLine system as 'matching North American preferences'. This explicitly links societal-level preferences (Environmental and Societal) as a causal factor influencing the design and strategy of an organization's product (Organizational). Only two distinct scales were identified, aligning with the limitation.

Full Paragraph Text: The new system introduces Centrifusion technology to achieve a high level of precision, using bar-code recognition to adjust the extraction parameters for each Grand Cru coffee, delivering the perfect cup. VertuoLine is pioneering a new segment of highest-quality, long-cup, freshly-brewed coffee. It brings the quality seal of espresso, the crema, to the world of freshly-brewed long-cup coffee.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph describes technical features and capabilities of a coffee system (Centrifusion technology, bar-code recognition, VertuoLine) but contains no actors taking actions that causally influence other actors across different scales. It is purely descriptive of product functionality without any cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: VertuoLine (a brand) acts as the initiating actor.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: A market segment is an industry-level construct.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] VertuoLine pioneers a new coffee segment, influencing the market structure.
gpt5: Rationale: The brand (Organizational) explicitly ‘pioneers a new segment,’ a sector-level outcome. Possible individual-level effects (perfect cup) are implied, so excluded to keep two scales and ensure explicit causality.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes technological features and product benefits without explicit cross-scale causal interactions.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to the consumer receiving 'the perfect cup'.; Organizational: Represents the product system 'VertuoLine' and its integrated 'Centrifusion technology' as an offering from a specific entity/brand.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the 'new segment of highest-quality, long-cup, freshly-brewed coffee' and 'the world of freshly-brewed long-cup coffee', which are market-level or societal consumption patterns.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The Organizational VertuoLine product, leveraging Centrifusion technology, delivers an individual perfect cup and pioneers a new market segment.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The analysis identifies three explicit cross-scale links. The Organizational VertuoLine product, via its Centrifusion technology, directly delivers a high-quality experience to the Individual consumer. Furthermore, VertuoLine's actions, such as pioneering a new segment and bringing unique qualities, explicitly influence the broader Environmental and Societal market. All identified actors map clearly to these three scales.

Full Paragraph Text: VertuoLine features a new line of 12 Grands Crus, eight large-cup coffees and four espresso blends. The machine is sold directly to consumers through the network of Nespresso boutiques, over the phone and online and at selected North American retailers.

Full Paragraph Text: The Nespresso AAA Sustainable Quality Programme, developed with the Rainforest Alliance, was launched in 2003. It aims to secure the highest sustainable quality coffee for Nespresso’s Grands Crus while helping to improve the livelihoods of coffee farmers and their families through support and training. Nespresso pays above-market prices for its coffee beans, as part of its commitment in the programme.

This represents a direct cross-scale interaction with explicit causal language.

The Rainforest Alliance is also a single organization.; Individual: Coffee farmers and their families are specific people or households.

Full Paragraph Text: At our 2014 CSV Forum, we announced that we will transform our European Youth Employment Initiative into a global programme. claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé (Organizational) taking deliberate action to help young people (Individual) through recruitment, development, and transition support. This represents a clear cross-scale causal influence from organizational policy to individual outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé and its Youth Employment Initiative/programme are organizational actors.; Individual: Next-generation Nestlé leaders and young people are individuals.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé’s initiative acts to recruit/develop leaders and help youth transition from education to work.

4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Young people transitioning from education to work.; Organizational: Nestlé as an organization implementing the initiative.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's global programme aims to assist young people in transitioning from education to work.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's initiative, which is an organizational action, having a direct impact on individuals (young people). This is a clear cross-scale interaction from Organizational to Individual.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people: 'next generation of Nestlé leaders' and 'young people'.; Organizational: Refers to a single organization (Nestlé) and its internal program: 'we' (Nestlé) and 'European Youth Employment Initiative'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to societal-level systems like 'education' and 'work' (representing the broader labor market or economy).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Nestlé's initiative aims to recruit, develop, and help individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states how an Organizational initiative (Nestlé's program) exerts a causal influence ('recruit', 'develop', 'help') on Individuals ('Nestlé leaders', 'young people'). While Environmental and Societal scales ('education', 'work') are mentioned as the context for individuals' transition, the text does not describe an explicit causal influence from or to these scales themselves, only that individuals are moving within them, aided by the Organizational actor.

Full Paragraph Text: For the Nestlé Needs YOUth programme in Europe, where one in four people under the age of 25 is unemployed, we pledged to offer 20000 jobs, apprenticeships and traineeships over three years, and establish readiness for work activities across our operations. We are well on schedule to achieve this with 11832 job and training opportunities created by the end of 2014 and around 1600 readiness for work events completed.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing the Needs YOUth programme with specific pledges and operations; Individual: Young people under 25 who are unemployed and receiving jobs, apprenticeships, traineeships, and readiness activities
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé creates jobs and training opportunities for unemployed youth through structured programme.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where Nestlé (organizational scale) directly provides employment and training opportunities to young individuals (individual scale). The company's deliberate actions create tangible outcomes for specific people.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé (via its Needs YOUth programme) pledges and executes actions.; Individual: Youth/people receiving jobs, apprenticeships, traineeships, and readiness events.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé’s programme creates and offers jobs, training, and readiness events to youth.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the company offered and created job/training opportunities, directly affecting individuals. The unemployment rate is context, not an explicit causal driver, so excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to people under the age of 25 who are unemployed.; Organizational: Refers to Nestlé and its operations offering jobs and training.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's job and training offerings directly impact unemployed youth under 25.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's organizational actions to provide jobs and training, which causally affect unemployed individuals. Only two scales are involved, making the link clear and direct.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'Nestlé' and 'we' refer to the company itself, and 'our operations' to its internal units.; Individual: 'people under the age of 25' refers to specific individuals as beneficiaries of jobs and traineeships.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's Organizational actions directly provide opportunities for individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states Nestlé (Organizational scale) 'pledged to offer' jobs and training opportunities to 'people under the age of 25' (Individual scale). This establishes a direct, explicit causal link from the Organizational level to the Individual level. Other mentions, like the unemployment rate, provide context but are not phrased as active causal influences in the interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: We built on the success of this initiative in 2014 by establishing the Alliance for YOUth, a collaboration with around 200 other companies, to scale up and coordinate our efforts to tackle youth unemployment. The efforts of the Alliance for YOUth will result in the creation of more than 100000 opportunities for young people in Europe.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: The Alliance for YOUth is explicitly described as 'a collaboration with around 200 other companies' - a multi-organizational alliance/sector initiative; Individual: Young people are the specific individuals who will receive the employment opportunities created by the alliance
claude4: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Individual] Alliance of 200 companies creates 100,000+ opportunities for young people in Europe.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where a multi-organizational alliance (Inter-Organizational scale) directly creates employment opportunities for individual young people (Individual scale). The causality is explicitly stated with 'will result in the creation of' opportunities.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'We' acts as a single organization establishing an initiative.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The Alliance for YOUth is a collaboration among ~200 companies.; Individual: Young people in Europe are individual beneficiaries.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Individual] An organization created an inter-firm alliance, whose efforts will create 100000+ opportunities for young people.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links an organization's action to forming an inter-organizational alliance, and states the alliance's efforts will create opportunities for individuals. We present the two pairwise links in this chain.
4o: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: The Alliance for YOUth is a collaboration among around 200 companies.; Individual: Young people in Europe are the individuals benefiting from the opportunities created.
4o: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Individual] The Alliance for YOUth will create opportunities for young people in Europe.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal link from the efforts of the Alliance for YOUth (Inter-Organizational / Sector) to the creation of opportunities for young people (Individual). No other scales are explicitly involved in a causal relationship.
gemini2.5: Scales: Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Individual
gemini2.5: Links: Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: The 'Alliance for YOUth' is explicitly described as a 'collaboration with around 200 other companies', aligning with the definition of systems or collaborations among organizations.; Environmental and Societal: 'Youth unemployment' represents a societal-level system or issue, falling under this scale.; Individual: 'Young people in Europe' refers to specific people who are the beneficiaries of the opportunities created.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Individual] An inter-organizational alliance works to tackle societal youth unemployment by creating direct opportunities for individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph highlights the 'Alliance for YOUth' (Inter-Organizational) in its efforts to address 'youth unemployment' (Environmental and Societal) and directly benefit 'young people' (Individual). While an 'Organizational' actor ('We') established the alliance, for the purpose of adhering to the protocol's limit of three distinct scales, the core ongoing actions and impacts of the alliance itself, rather than its formation, are prioritized here due to their explicit description and central role in the paragraph's overall message.

Full Paragraph Text: We will continue to lead the initiative to help tackle youth unemployment in Europe and globally, offering young people the chance of a more secure and productive future.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph contains only a general commitment statement about leading an initiative to tackle youth unemployment. While it mentions 'we' (unclear actor) and 'young people' (individuals), there is no explicit causal action described - only an intention to 'continue to lead' and 'offer chances.' No concrete cross-scale influence or causality is stated.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We” denotes an organization leading an initiative.; Environmental and Societal: Youth unemployment is a societal-level issue.; Individual: Young people are individuals affected by the initiative.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal, Individual] The organization’s initiative aims to reduce youth unemployment and offer young people a more secure, productive future.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties an organization’s initiative to societal outcomes (tackling youth unemployment) and to individual benefits (opportunities for youth). Three scales are used, each with direct cross-scale effects.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not explicitly describe a causal influence across different scales. It mentions an initiative but lacks specific actors or actions that demonstrate cross-scale causality.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: 'young people' refers to specific individuals within society.; Organizational: 'We' refers to a single, organized entity (e.g., a company or NGO) leading an initiative.; Environmental and Societal: 'youth unemployment' represents a societal-level issue.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] An organizational entity tackles societal youth unemployment, offering individuals a chance for a better future.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The entity identified as 'We' (Organizational) explicitly states its intention to 'tackle youth unemployment' (Environmental and Societal), demonstrating a clear causal link from an organization to a societal issue. Furthermore, this action is stated to be 'offering young people' (Individual) a chance for a better future, establishing a direct causal influence from the Organizational scale to the Individual scale. The paragraph clearly involves three distinct scales: Individual, Organizational, and Environmental and Societal, all with explicit causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: By 2020, one billion people in the world will be over 60, in creasing the burden on society from obesity and chronic diseases. It is estimated global healthcare costs could rise to between USD 5–10 trillion by the end of the decade. At the same time scientific understanding of health, disease and the potential of nutrition is growing.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: One billion people over 60 with obesity and chronic diseases represents individuals with health conditions; Environmental and Societal: Society bearing the burden and global healthcare costs represent societal-level systems and impacts
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] Aging population with chronic diseases increases societal burden and healthcare costs.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes how individual health conditions (obesity and chronic diseases in people over 60) causally increase the burden on society and drive up global healthcare costs, representing a clear Individual to Environmental and Societal scale interaction.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: “one billion people…over 60” are specific people.; Environmental and Societal: “burden on society” and “global healthcare costs” are societal-level outcomes.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual|Environmental and Societal] Aging individuals increase society’s burden from chronic disease.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that more older individuals increase the burden on society, a cross-scale causal effect. Other statements (costs may rise, science is growing) lack explicit cross-scale causality.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses demographic changes and potential impacts on healthcare costs, but does not explicitly describe a causal influence across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'one billion people over 60', an aggregate of individuals whose demographic shift causes a broader impact.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'society' and 'global healthcare costs', representing a societal-level system and economic metric.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] The increase in the number of individuals over 60 is explicitly stated to increase the burden on society.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly identifies one cross-scale causal interaction: the rising number of 'one billion people' (Individual scale) 'increasing the burden on society' (Environmental and Societal scale). While 'global healthcare costs' are mentioned, their rise is implied as a consequence of the societal burden, not directly from the individual scale in an explicit cross-scale statement. Only two distinct scales are involved, adhering to the limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science aims to champion the role of nutritional therapies that have proven clinical and health economic value, and improve the quality of people’s lives. The company focuses on three areas: Consumer Care, which aims to address specific health conditions with an emphasis on enhancing ‘healthy ageing’; Medical Nutrition, which supplies hospitals and other healthcare facilities; and Novel Therapeutic nutrition, which works on new nutritional therapies (including pre scribed medicines) for specific diseases and conditions that would be administered by a health professional.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Health Science's organizational structure and business focus areas but does not contain any explicit causal interactions between different scales. It presents static descriptions of what the company 'aims to do' and 'focuses on' without describing actual actions that influence or are influenced by actors at other scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Health professionals are specific people who would administer therapies.; Organizational: Novel Therapeutic nutrition is a formal unit within Nestlé Health Science developing therapies.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Novel Therapeutic nutrition develops therapies that would be administered by health professionals.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is the unit’s therapies leading to administration by health professionals. Supply to hospitals is organizational-to-organizational, and “aims to” statements are not causal effects.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Health Science's focus areas but does not explicitly state any causal influence across different hierarchical scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people ('people's lives') and 'health professional'.; Organizational: Refers to a single company ('Nestlé Health Science') and its internal units ('Consumer Care', 'Medical Nutrition', 'Novel Therapeutic nutrition'), as well as other single organizations ('hospitals and other healthcare facilities').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Nestlé Health Science's organizational actions directly improve individual lives and develop therapies administered by individual health professionals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: Two explicit cross-scale causal links were identified. Nestlé Health Science (Organizational) directly impacts 'people's lives' (Individual) by improving quality. Additionally, an internal organizational unit, Novel Therapeutic nutrition, develops therapies that are administered by 'health professionals' (Individual), indicating an organizational influence on individual action. Only Individual and Organizational scales were explicitly involved.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science is supported in its work by the Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences (NIHS) which under takes fundamental scientific research into how nutrition can be used to empower people to improve and maintain their health. NIHS research teams are providing greater insight into how our environment, diet and lifestyle intersect with our genetic make-up, gut microorganisms, metabolism and nutritional status to determine our health.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational structure and research activities but lacks explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions how various factors intersect to determine health, this describes correlational relationships rather than explicit cross-scale causality between distinct actors.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The text mentions 'our environment' as a determinant.; Individual: The text refers to 'people' and 'our health'.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Individual] The environment is stated to determine people's health.
gpt5: Rationale: Only the environment-to-health causal link crosses scales and is explicit. Organizational mentions (NIHS supporting Nestlé Health Science) are same-scale and do not form cross-scale links.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes research activities and insights but does not explicitly state a causal influence across different hierarchical scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people', 'our health', 'diet', 'lifestyle', 'genetic make-up', 'gut microorganisms', 'metabolism', and 'nutritional status', all relating to specific persons or their biological states.; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé Health Science', 'Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences (NIHS)', and 'NIHS research teams', all being single organizations or their internal units.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'our environment', which encompasses broader societal or ecological systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Individual, Organizational] Organizational research aims to empower individuals, while the environment is explicitly stated to determine individual health.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph provides two explicit cross-scale causal links. The first describes how the Organizational scale (NIHS's research) aims to influence and empower the Individual scale (people). The second highlights an explicit causal relationship where the Environmental and Societal scale (our environment) directly determines the Individual scale (our health), a relationship that NIHS studies.

Full Paragraph Text: NIHS has established the first complete essential nutrient profiling platform for accurate analysis of nutrient status. This research offers the prospect of developing personalised nutrition products, including dietary recommendations.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé’s Jian Xin Double Care, a specially designed milk to enhance heart and bone health for middle-aged and senior adults, was launched in China in December 2013. The product contains phytosterols, which lower LDL (‘bad’) cholesterol, as well as calcium and vitamin D. The brand raises awareness of heart health with in-store health checks and offers toll-free phone contact with doctors to discuss cardiovascular health.

This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from organizational to individual level.

Full Paragraph Text: Golden Morn is a ready-to-eat breakfast cereal sold in Nigeria, made of maize or millet, and fortified with micronutrients vitamin A and iron.

gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company that transformed the dairy factory and implemented the zero water manufacturing system; Environmental and Societal: The surrounding area community of 6400 people whose daily water consumption needs are being met
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Company's zero water factory saves water equivalent to 6400 people's daily consumption.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational innovation (zero water manufacturing) directly benefits the broader community by conserving water resources equivalent to their consumption needs.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company transformed a factory and used milk-derived water in its systems.; Environmental and Societal: Water savings in the surrounding area are explicitly stated.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The company’s zero-water factory operation saves water in the surrounding area.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links a company manufacturing change to water savings in the area. The 6400-people metric is an equivalence, not a direct effect on individuals, so Individual links are omitted.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The dairy factory in Mexico is an organizational entity.; Environmental and Societal: The water savings impact the daily consumption of people in the surrounding area, a societal-level effect.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The factory's water-saving measures impact the water availability for the local population.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal link from the factory's actions (Organizational) to the societal impact on water consumption (Environmental and Societal). No other scales are involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'company' (implied by 'we') and the 'dairy factory' are considered single organizations or formal internal units.; Individual: '6400 people in the surrounding area' refers to specific people or households.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The company's water-saving measures directly meet the daily water consumption needs of individuals in the surrounding area.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the company's (Organizational) water extraction and saving practices result in enough water to 'meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people' (Individual). This establishes a clear cross-scale causal link from the organizational level's actions to an impact on the individual level.

Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico as a specific company implementing water-saving technology and initiatives; Environmental and Societal: Water-stressed areas around the world representing broader environmental conditions that influence corporate decisions
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Water-stressed conditions drive Nestlé to deploy water-saving technology across multiple sites.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how environmental conditions (water stress in various global areas) are causing organizational response (Nestlé deploying technology). This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship where societal-environmental pressures influence corporate technological decisions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All stated causal effects are within the organization (factory processes reducing Nestlé Mexico’s water use). No explicit cross-scale impact on societal/environmental systems or other scales is described.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico and its manufacturing sites are specific organizations.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The deployment of technology across multiple manufacturing sites indicates a sector-level initiative.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé Mexico's water-saving technology is being expanded to other sites, showing cross-scale influence.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé Mexico's technology is being implemented in other sites, indicating a clear cross-scale interaction from Organizational to Inter-Organizational / Sector. This is the most explicit link present.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to a single company (Nestlé Mexico, 'we' referring to the broader Nestlé organization) and its internal units (factory, manufacturing sites).; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the state of natural resources ('total amount of water used', 'total water withdrawal') and broader environmental conditions ('water stressed areas').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's organizational actions reduce its water withdrawal, which is influenced by environmental conditions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph illustrates a reciprocal interaction between the Organizational and Environmental and Societal scales. Nestlé's (Organizational) deployment of technology and initiatives directly reduces its water withdrawal (Environmental and Societal impact). Conversely, the condition of 'water stressed areas' (Environmental and Societal) influences the organization's strategic decision to focus its technology deployment in those specific regions.

Full Paragraph Text: Today our people are carrying out 170 water-saving projects in Nestlé factories, which will save around 3.6 million cubic metres of water.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: The 'people' refers to specific workers/employees carrying out the projects; Organizational: Nestlé factories represent the organizational infrastructure and operations
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Workers implement water-saving projects that reduce factory water consumption by 3.6 million cubic metres.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes individual workers taking action that causally affects organizational-level outcomes (factory water savings). The link is explicit through the phrase 'people are carrying out projects in Nestlé factories.'

gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] Employees’ water-saving projects in Nestlé factories will save ~3.6 million m3 of water.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links individual-led projects to environmental outcomes (water saved). Organizational context (factories) is descriptive; the causal effect stated is on water resources.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal action where individuals are implementing projects that affect the organizational level (Nestlé factories). Only two scales are involved, making the link straightforward.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how 'our people' (Individual scale) 'are carrying out' projects (Organizational scale), and these 'projects' (Organizational scale) 'will save' water (Environmental and Societal scale). This establishes a clear chain of cross-scale causation involving three distinct levels.

Full Paragraph Text: In March 2014, we opened the Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing, China. The new centre has three objectives: to collaborate with Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities in food safety research; to increase our ability to assess risks, anticipate problems and provide accurate information in any food safety situations; and to engage on scientific communication and food safety training.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a single company opening the Food Safety Institute and taking specific actions; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities representing multiple organizations that Nestlé collaborates with
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé opens institute to collaborate with Chinese universities and regulatory authorities on food safety.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé as a single organization establishing collaboration with multiple external organizations (universities, research institutes, regulatory authorities). This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from organizational to inter-organizational level through the explicit collaboration objective.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A

4o: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Nestlé Food Safety Institute's collaboration with other entities shows cross-scale interaction.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's organizational efforts to engage with other organizations, creating a clear cross-scale link. No other scales are involved.

gemini2.5: Summary: N/A

While it mentions collaboration with different entities, including 'regulatory authorities' (Environmental and Societal), the text only states the *act of collaboration* ('to collaborate with') and does not explicitly state a causal influence or effect from one scale upon another. The other objectives focus on internal organizational capabilities or unspecified engagement targets.

gemini2.5: Summary: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé is deeply integrated into people’s lives with many buying our products on a daily basis. This gives us opportunities to contribute meaningfully to their quality of life. It is what our promise of Good Food, Good Life is all about: offering the best tasting, healthiest choices across a wide range of food and beverages, from morning to night and throughout life, helping people to live more enjoyable, healthy lives.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company offering products and making promises about quality of life; Individual: People who buy Nestlé products daily and whose quality of life is affected

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes how Nestlé (organizational scale) causally influences individuals' quality of life through its product offerings and promise of 'Good Food, Good Life.' The company explicitly states it helps people live more enjoyable, healthy lives, establishing clear cross-scale causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: People/consumers buying products and experiencing quality of life impacts.; Organizational: Nestlé, which offers products and acts on opportunities.
