No explicit causal verbs or mechanisms linking actions/states between different scales are present.

Full Paragraph Text: There is therefore both a business and a moral case for ensuring that human rights are upheld across our operations and our value chain. In giving effect to our Human Rights Policy Statement, we continue to raise awareness, build capacity and engage with others to address root causes and provide remedies where needed.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('our operations') implementing human rights policies and taking specific actions; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The value chain representing multiple interconnected organizations across which human rights must be upheld
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Company implements human rights policies across its value chain operations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a company taking organizational-level actions (implementing human rights policy, raising awareness, building capacity) that explicitly influence and ensure compliance across their value chain, which represents an inter-organizational system of multiple connected entities.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We/our operations” refers to a single company implementing its Human Rights Policy.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: “Value chain” spans multiple organizations such as suppliers and partners.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] The company seeks to ensure human rights across its value chain, indicating organizational influence on inter-org systems.
gpt5: Rationale: A single company acts via its policy to ensure human rights across the value chain, explicitly linking organizational action to a multi-organization system. Other actions (awareness, capacity, engagement) lack specified targets, so excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses actions related to human rights within operations and value chains but does not explicitly describe causal cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'human rights' as a societal norm and concept, and 'root causes' and 'remedies' pertaining to broad societal issues.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company/organization) and 'our operations', indicating a single organizational entity and its internal activities.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to 'our value chain', which represents a system of multiple organizations collaborating or linked in a supply network.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] Societal human rights norms drive an organization to uphold these rights within its value chain and actively address broader societal issues.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how the existence of societal 'human rights' creates a 'moral case' for the organization to act (Societal -> Organizational). The organization then takes direct action to ensure these rights are upheld within its 'value chain' (Organizational -> Inter-Organizational). Furthermore, the organization engages in activities to 'address root causes and provide remedies' related to human rights issues at the broader societal level (Organizational -> Environmental and Societal).

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we strengthened the enhancing livelihoods ambition of the USLP. An integral part of this is our implementation of the UN Guiding Principle on Business and Human Rights and our public reporting on this. We also committed to enhancing access to training and skills for women and to advancing women’s rights. A key aspect of this has been our safety programme for women and girls, with the involvement of men and boys, which we have begun at our tea plantation in Kericho, Kenya, in response to reports of sexual harassment in 2013. The programme is being rolled out to other locations. More information on our progress on women’s rights is in the Society section on pages 22 to 24, with full details to be published in our Sustainable Living Report 2014 which will be found on www.unilever.com/sustainable-living in May 2015.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Reports of sexual harassment in 2013 represent individual-level experiences and complaints; Organizational: Unilever as a company implementing safety programmes and policies in response to these reports
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Individual harassment reports prompted company to implement safety programme at tea plantation.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows clear causality where individual-level reports of sexual harassment directly led to organizational-level policy implementation. The company explicitly states the safety programme was implemented 'in response to reports of sexual harassment in 2013', establishing direct causal linkage between individual experiences and organizational action.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Women and girls (and men and boys) at the tea plantation; people reporting sexual harassment; Organizational: Unilever implementing programs and practices at its tea plantation
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Reports of sexual harassment led Unilever to start a safety program for women and girls, directly targeting individuals.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties individual reports to the company initiating a safety program (Individual -> Organizational). It also states the program is for women and girls, showing Organizational -> Individual influence. Only these two scales are used.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever's implementation of programs and reporting.; Environmental and Societal: The societal impact on women's rights and safety.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's safety programme aims to address societal issues of sexual harassment.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's organizational actions (safety programme) that causally influence societal issues (women's rights and safety). The link is clear between Unilever's efforts and societal impact, justifying the scales chosen.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual | Individual -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Specific people (women, girls, men, boys) or their actions/experiences (reports of sexual harassment, access to skills, rights).; Organizational: A single company ('we' refers to Unilever), its internal plans (USLP), or specific operational units (tea plantation, safety programme).; Environmental and Societal: Societal-level systems or norms (UN Guiding Principle on Business and Human Rights) that transcend individual organizations or people.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] An organization implements societal principles, responds to individual reports, and commits to programs impacting individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes how a company (Organizational) is guided by international norms (Environmental and Societal) and commits to actions that impact individuals. It also shows a feedback loop where individual experiences (reports of harassment) trigger organizational responses (safety programme). All three identified scales are clearly and explicitly linked, with multiple causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: This Strategic Report lays out how Unilever’s business works, the highlights of 2014 and the underlying importance of the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP), to ensure that our business will remain relevant to future generations of consumers and investors. The following pages reveal how this adds up to sustainable value for shareholders.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a company implementing the USLP business strategy; Individual: Future generations of consumers and investors as specific people who will be affected by the strategy
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's sustainable strategy ensures relevance to future consumers and investors.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Unilever (Organizational) implements a strategic plan that causally influences its relevance to future consumers and investors (Individual). This represents a clear cross-scale interaction where organizational strategy directly targets individual stakeholders.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever’s business and its Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) are organizational actors.; Individual: Consumers, investors, and shareholders are people/groups of people.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever’s USLP seeks to keep the business relevant to consumers and investors, showing org actions shaping individuals.
gpt5: Rationale: We map Unilever/USLP to Organizational and consumers/investors/shareholders to Individual. The text explicitly states USLP ensures relevance to consumers/investors (Org->Ind). Shareholder value implies the same link; avoided duplicate.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's strategic focus and its impact on shareholders, but it does not explicitly state a causal influence across different hierarchical scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever's business and the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) represent a single organization and its internal strategic initiative.; Individual: Consumers, investors, and shareholders are specific people or groups of individuals directly impacted by Unilever's actions.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's business and strategic plan influence its relevance and value for individual consumers, investors, and shareholders.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'Unilever’s business' and the 'Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP)' (Organizational scale actors) act to 'ensure' relevance to 'consumers' and 'investors' (Individual scale actors), and 'adds up to sustainable value for shareholders' (Individual scale actors). These are clear, explicit causal influences across the Organizational to Individual scales. All identified links demonstrate the same cross-scale direction. Only two distinct scales were identified, well within the limit of three.

Full Paragraph Text: At Unilever we look to the future and what the consumer of tomorrow will need. This has inevitably drawn us to increase our business in emerging markets where population and consumption growth offer attractive opportunities. In 2014, 57% of our turnover was generated in emerging markets.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's strategic business positioning and market focus but does not establish explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions consumers (Individual scale) and Unilever as a company (Organizational scale), there is no clear causality stated - only business strategy and market observations about where revenue is generated.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: ‘Consumer of tomorrow’ refers to consumers (people) whose anticipated needs are cited.; Organizational: Unilever is a single company deciding to increase its business.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Anticipated consumer needs drew Unilever to increase its business in emerging markets.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties anticipated consumer needs to Unilever’s decision to expand. While population/consumption growth is mentioned, it’s less directly framed as the causal driver and was omitted to keep scale count low.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company, thus mapped to Organizational.; Environmental and Societal: Emerging markets represent societal-level systems with population and consumption growth.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Emerging market growth drives Unilever's business strategy.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal-level growth in emerging markets causally influences Unilever's organizational strategy. This is a clear cross-scale interaction between Environmental and Societal and Organizational scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company, fitting the definition of a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: Emerging markets, population growth, and consumption growth represent broad societal and economic conditions that influence business at a macro level.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Societal trends like population and consumption growth in emerging markets directly influence Unilever's organizational business expansion strategy.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'population and consumption growth' within 'emerging markets' (Environmental and Societal scale) 'offer attractive opportunities' which 'has inevitably drawn us [Unilever]' (Organizational scale) to increase business. This establishes a clear causal link from societal conditions to organizational strategy. Although 'consumer of tomorrow' (Individual scale) is mentioned, no explicit causal influence or action is described between the Individual scale and other scales in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: These markets also bring challenges. Performance can prove volatile as witnessed in 2014. Economies have slowed and exchange rates have weakened leading to a reduction in consumer spending.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Economies and exchange rates represent societal-level economic systems; Individual: Consumer spending refers to actions by individual consumers/households
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Individual] Economic conditions caused consumers to reduce spending.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes a causal chain where macroeconomic conditions (slowed economies and weakened exchange rates) directly led to changes in individual consumer behavior (reduced spending). This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from societal-level economic systems to individual actions.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Economies and exchange rates are societal-level economic systems.; Individual: Consumer spending reflects behavior of consumers/households.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal -> Individual] Slower economies and weaker exchange rates reduced consumer spending.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links slowed economies and weakened exchange rates to reduced consumer spending. These are societal-level factors causally affecting individual behavior; no other scales are explicitly linked.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links societal-level economic conditions to individual consumer behavior. No other scales are involved, so the detected scales are limited to Environmental and Societal and Individual.

Changes at the macro-level (slowed economies and weakened exchange rates) are directly stated as 'leading to' an impact on micro-level behavior (reduced consumer spending).

Full Paragraph Text: That said, over time emerging markets have delivered Unilever a source of remarkably consistent growth. Over the past five years, emerging markets have generated underlying sales growth averaging 9% a year.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a correlation between emerging markets and Unilever's growth performance, but does not establish explicit causal relationships between actors at different scales. It presents statistical outcomes rather than describing how specific actors influence each other across hierarchical levels.

The second sentence reinforces the growth generated by emerging markets but does not establish an additional distinct causal link to another specific actor scale.

Full Paragraph Text: These markets are also among the most sensitive to environmental and social pressures brought about by growth in population and consumption and the activities of companies such as Unilever. That’s why our USLP goals are to improve health and well-being, reduce our environmental impact and enhance livelihoods through direct action and partnerships.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Environmental and social pressures from population growth and consumption patterns represent societal-level forces; Organizational: Unilever is identified as a specific company taking direct action through its USLP goals
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Societal pressures drive Unilever to establish sustainability goals and take direct action.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that environmental and social pressures from societal factors (population growth, consumption) influence Unilever's corporate response through their USLP goals. This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship from societal pressures to organizational action.
gpt5: Scales: Organizational, Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Companies such as Unilever and its USLP goals/actions.; Environmental and Societal: Environmental and social pressures; population and consumption growth.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: “These markets” refers to market/sector systems affected by pressures.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links company activities to environmental/social pressures and states markets are sensitive to those pressures. This yields a chain: Organizational -> Environmental/Societal -> Inter-Organizational/Sector.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company, which is an organization.; Environmental and Societal: Population growth and consumption are societal-level systems.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal pressures impact organizational actions, specifically mentioning Unilever. This establishes a clear cross-scale causal link from Environmental and Societal to Organizational.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people or households, evident in 'health and well-being' and 'livelihoods', which impact individuals directly.; Organizational: Represents specific companies like 'Unilever' and their internal initiatives such as 'USLP goals' and 'activities of companies'.; Environmental and Societal: Encompasses broad systems and trends like 'markets', 'environmental and social pressures', 'growth in population and consumption', and 'environmental impact'.

Subsequently, it outlines how Organizational goals (Unilever's USLP) are set to improve outcomes for Individual actors (health, livelihoods) and mitigate broader Environmental and Societal impacts. Three distinct scales—Individual, Organizational, and Environmental and Societal—were identified with clear causal relationships.

Full Paragraph Text: Our efforts have been recognised and Unilever is No.1 in the Dow Jones Sustainability Index for Food, Beverage & Tobacco.

gpt5: Summary: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: Our long-term track record of delivery for shareholders continued during 2014 despite some significant challenges in the business environment. These included continued weak consumer demand in developed markets, slowing demand in emerging markets and currency devaluations in many countries. The resilience of our business and the broad nature of our brand portfolio and geographic reach enabled us to deliver a year of steady progress in slower markets.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance and market conditions but lacks explicit causal relationships between actors at different scales. While it mentions consumer demand, currency devaluations, and company delivery, these are presented as contextual factors rather than explicit cross-scale influences with clear causality.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Macro conditions like weak demand and currency devaluations are framed as 'business environment' challenges.; Organizational: The company ('our business') and its brand portfolio/geographic reach act and deliver results.; Individual: Shareholders are people receiving the firm's delivery.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Macro challenges (weak demand, currency devaluations) pressured the company, and the company continued delivering outcomes to shareholders.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly frames macroeconomic factors as challenges affecting the company, establishing Environmental and Societal -> Organizational. It also states the firm delivered for shareholders, supporting Organizational -> Individual. No other explicit cross-scale effects are stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company and its brand portfolio are organizational actors.; Environmental and Societal: Consumer demand and currency devaluations are societal-level factors.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Societal factors like weak demand and currency devaluations influenced the company's performance.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal-level factors such as consumer demand and currency devaluations affected the company's ability to deliver for shareholders. This establishes a clear cross-scale causal link from Environmental and Societal to Organizational.
gemini2.5: Links: Individual -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'consumer demand' which originates from individual consumers.; Organizational: Refers to 'our business' and 'us' (the reporting company) as a single entity.; Environmental and Societal: Encompasses 'developed markets', 'emerging markets', and 'currency devaluations in many countries' which are macroeconomic or governmental phenomena.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Weak consumer demand and currency devaluations posed significant challenges for the organizational business, which demonstrated resilience.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly identifies external factors as challenges impacting the company's operations. Specifically, 'weak consumer demand' and 'slowing demand' (Individual scale) directly affected the Organizational scale. Concurrently, 'currency devaluations' (Environmental and Societal scale) also posed significant challenges for the Organizational scale. The analysis correctly identifies and utilizes three distinct scales: Individual, Organizational, and Environmental and Societal, all connected by explicit causal language.

Full Paragraph Text: In a lower growth environment we stepped up our cost savings initiatives. We accelerated Project Half for Growth which is simplifying the business and reducing costs, particularly in overheads. As a result we were able to continue to invest in sustained brand and marketing investment and deliver underlying sales growth ahead of our markets and a further improvement in core operating margin.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal organizational activities (cost savings initiatives, Project Half for Growth, brand investment) and their outcomes (sales growth, margin improvement) but does not establish any explicit causal relationships between different hierarchical scales. All actions and effects remain within the organizational level without cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: A 'lower growth environment' denotes macroeconomic conditions.; Organizational: 'We' refers to the company taking actions (cost savings, project acceleration).
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] A lower growth environment prompted the company to step up cost-saving actions.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly ties macroeconomic conditions to an organizational response. Other effects (project actions, margins, sales) are internal outcomes without cross-scale causality, so no additional links.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company is implementing cost savings initiatives and Project Half for Growth.; Environmental and Societal: The broader market environment is influencing the company's growth strategies.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] The lower growth environment caused the company to implement cost-saving measures.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how the broader market environment (Environmental and Societal) influenced the company's (Organizational) decision to implement cost-saving measures. This is a clear cross-scale causal link.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Refers to the broader economic context ('lower growth environment') and the general market conditions ('our markets').; Organizational: Represents the specific company ('we'), its internal strategies ('cost savings initiatives', 'Project Half for Growth'), and its performance ('underlying sales growth', 'core operating margin').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] A lower growth environment prompted the organization to implement cost-saving measures.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states a causal link where the 'lower growth environment' (Environmental and Societal scale) influenced the company's (Organizational scale) decision to increase cost savings. While the company's performance was 'ahead of our markets', this describes a relative outcome rather than a direct causal influence between the Organizational and Environmental and Societal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We took action to reshape our portfolio to ensure we have the right mix of brands to address growth opportunities today and in the future.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes an organizational action ('we took action to reshape our portfolio') but does not specify any causal influence between different scales. The statement is about internal portfolio management without explicit cross-scale causality to individuals, other organizations, or societal factors.

Full Paragraph Text: In June 2014 we sold the Ragu and Bertolli pasta sauces business in North America for approximately US $2.15 billion to Mizkan Group. In Europe we disposed of our meat snacks business to Jack Link’s. We also sold our Royal pasta brand in the Philippines for US $48 million and our Slim. Fast business in the US.

Therefore, no explicit cross-scale causal interactions are present.

Full Paragraph Text: In December 2014 we bought Talenti Gelato & Sorbetto in the US. We also committed to acquire the skin cleansing brands Camay, globally, and Zest outside North America and the Caribbean. Our Mexican market position will be a particular beneficiary of these deals.

Full Paragraph Text: We are also taking action to make sure that we get the most out of our core business by making sharper choices within our existing category portfolio and addressing areas of under-performance. For example, we have set a clear target to double our core operating margin in Home Care over the coming years, as this is a category where profitability is relatively low. We also announced a new stand-alone business unit for European and North American spreads, whereturnover has been declining. The new unit, called Baking, Cooking and Spreading, will be fully in place by the middle of 2015. It will bring greater focus, address new growth opportunities, and has a clear objective to stabilise sales while maintaining strong cash delivery.

The company is making internal strategic decisions about business units and performance targets, but there are no explicit causal interactions described between different hierarchical scales. This represents intra-organizational activity rather than cross-scale interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: In March 2014 Unilever announced the issuance of our first ever green sustainability bond which raised £250 million. The fixed rate notes pay a coupon of 2% and are due for repayment in 2018. The proceeds are being deployed on projects which support the achievement of the goals of the USLP in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, water usage and production of waste.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Capital markets that provided the £250 million funding through bond issuance; Organizational: Unilever as a single company issuing bonds and deploying proceeds on sustainability projects
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Capital markets fund Unilever's sustainability projects through green bond.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes explicit causality where capital markets (Environmental and Societal scale) provide funding that enables Unilever (Organizational scale) to deploy proceeds on sustainability projects. This represents clear cross-scale interaction with financial resources flowing from societal-level markets to organizational-level implementation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever issues the bond and deploys proceeds on projects.; Environmental and Societal: Targets are reductions in greenhouse gas emissions, water use, and waste (environmental outcomes).
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever’s bond funds projects that support reductions in emissions, water use, and waste.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states Unilever uses bond proceeds for projects supporting environmental reductions, an org action affecting environmental outcomes. Investors/capital markets are not explicitly mentioned as causal actors, so excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company, which is an organization.; Environmental and Societal: The goals of reducing greenhouse gas emissions, water usage, and waste production are societal-level environmental concerns.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's green bond issuance aims to achieve societal environmental goals.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's action of issuing a green bond, which is intended to support environmental goals. This creates a clear cross-scale link from the organizational level to the societal level. No other scales are involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever, its USLP (Unilever Sustainable Living Plan), and the projects it funds are all components or initiatives of a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: Greenhouse gas emissions, water usage, and waste production represent environmental impacts which are part of the broader Environmental and Societal scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's organizational strategy via its USLP, supported by funded projects, aims to reduce environmental impacts such as greenhouse gas emissions and waste.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's (Organizational) actions, specifically the deployment of bond proceeds on projects supporting the USLP. The explicit purpose of these projects and USLP goals is 'in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, water usage and production of waste'. This establishes a direct causal link from the Organizational scale to the Environmental and Societal scale, as the organization's efforts are aimed at influencing environmental metrics.

Full Paragraph Text: In India around 600 million people, like Saritadevi (pictured*), do not have access to a toilet in their house, leaving them no choice but to use local fields. Unilever is committed to helping 25 million people gain improved access to a toilet by 2020, by promoting the benefits of using clean toilets and making toilets accessible.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: 600 million people in India, including Saritadevi, who lack access to toilets and must use local fields; Organizational: Unilever as a single company with a specific commitment to help 25 million people gain toilet access
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever commits to helping 25 million people gain toilet access through promotion and accessibility.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear cross-scale interaction where Unilever (organizational scale) is taking action to directly influence individuals' access to toilets. The causality is explicit through Unilever's commitment to help people gain toilet access.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a single company committing to actions.; Individual: People/households (e.g., Saritadevi; 25 million people) receiving access to toilets.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever’s actions aim to help people gain access to toilets.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states Unilever will help individuals gain toilet access through promotion and accessibility measures. Other details describe conditions of individuals, not cross-scale causes.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people like Saritadevi and the 600 million individuals without access to toilets.; Organizational: Unilever is an organization committed to improving access to toilets.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Unilever aims to improve toilet access for individuals, showing a direct organizational impact on individual lives.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's organizational efforts to improve toilet access for individuals, establishing a clear cross-scale causal link. No other scales are involved, so the focus remains on the direct impact from Organizational to Individual.
gemini2.5: Links: Individual -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Saritadevi and the '600 million people' or '25 million people' represent specific individuals or households directly experiencing access issues or receiving assistance.; Organizational: Unilever is a single company.; Environmental and Societal: 'Local fields' represent a public or shared natural space, part of the broader environment or community infrastructure. 'Access to a toilet' also implies a societal-level infrastructure and health issue.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Individuals without toilet access use local fields, and an organization works to improve individuals' access to sanitation.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details two cross-scale interactions. Firstly, individuals' lack of infrastructure directly impacts environmental/societal spaces. Secondly, an organization's initiatives are directly aimed at improving conditions for individuals. All three identified scales (Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal) are central to these explicit causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: We are working with multiple partners, including UNICEF, to create sustainable approaches to better sanitation by promoting good hygiene practices to improve the health and well-being of communities and helping to create demand for access to toilets.

This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship from organizational to environmental/societal level.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that a multi-organization partnership promotes hygiene to improve community health and create demand for toilets, a cross-scale effect on communities. No explicit individual-level behavior change is stated, so scales are limited to these two.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational: The phrase 'We are working with multiple partners, including UNICEF' explicitly describes a collaborative effort among several organizations, fitting the Inter-Organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: The term 'communities' along with their 'health and well-being' and 'demand for access' clearly represents a societal-level system, mapping to Environmental and Societal.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph details how a collaborative effort among organizations (Inter-Organizational) exerts causal influence on 'communities' (Environmental and Societal). Full Paragraph Text: We are also working with Water & Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) to develop innovative sanitation businesses and promote hygiene communications to millions of the poorest consumers in Ghana, Bangladesh, Kenya and Zambia.

Full Paragraph Text: And we are providing support through the Domestos Toilet Academy, a market-based model that improves sanitation in India and Vietnam. By the end of 2014 there were ten Domestos Toilet Academies open, eight in India and two in Vietnam. The Academies train entrepreneurs to form businesses supplying, installing and maintaining hygienic toilets. The initiative will train 250 entrepreneurs and supply 51,000 toilets by the end of 2015.

claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Domestos Toilet Academy trains entrepreneurs to form sanitation businesses.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational program (Domestos Toilet Academy) directly trains and enables individual entrepreneurs to start businesses. This represents explicit cross-scale causality from organizational to individual level.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Entrepreneurs are specific people (individuals) who receive training and form businesses.; Organizational: The 'Domestos Toilet Academy' is a specific program/unit, and the 'businesses' formed by entrepreneurs are distinct single organizations.; Environmental and Societal: 'Sanitation' refers to a societal-level system or condition being improved by the initiative.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Domestos Toilet Academy trains entrepreneurs who form businesses that directly improve societal sanitation.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph details a multi-step causal chain. An Organizational entity (Domestos Toilet Academy) trains Individuals (entrepreneurs). These Individuals then proceed to establish new Organizational entities (businesses). These newly formed Organizations then directly influence and improve the Environmental and Societal condition (sanitation). All three identified scales are explicitly linked in this progressive interaction.
